channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish on Melon Road near Frank House, 5th February
item.description:
There's regularly big piles of black bin bags and rubbish at this location, and it's usually cleared up very slowly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Peckham High Street, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: Fridge left dumped on the avenue next to substation, 5th February
item.description:
Someone has dumped a fridge on the avenue, it's been there for at least a few days. Please remove it's a nice piece of road where people regularly walk, it's not a dumping ground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car blocking pavement, 5th February
item.description:
Abandoned car blocking pavement. Has been reported numerous times and you keep marking it as closes without resolving it. Do your job and sort it out.

item.title: Communal recycling bin was not emptied this week, 5th February
item.description:

item.title: White van dumped on double yellow lines and dangerous for us neighbours trying to leave our drive ways and itâ€™s obstructing the view, 5th February
item.description:
This van has no tax or Mot nearly 3 month expired. Please remove asap

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Portland Avenue, Hackney, London

item.title: By 37 Mill Ln, London NW6 1NB :Zebra Crossing, 5th February
item.description:
This is perennial problem. I reported it 2 years ago. A very serious hole in road has developed again on the zebra crossing. People who are local slow down to avoid damage to their vehicles, this dangerously holds up people who are not local and not expecting a vehicle to brake (if no people visible on or near zebra crossing). The hole is danger to vehicles and pedestrians You keep patching it up every year, poorly. It needs to be stripped and relayed properly. The hole is pehaps 30cm by 20 cm, directly on the zebra crossing, 70cm on the road from the curb.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Mill Lane, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two dips in road surface, 5th February
item.description:
These two dips have clearly been left after previous roadworks and just keep getting deeper. Both have been there for months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yester Road, Elmstead, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Unlit skip, 5th February
item.description:
There has been a skip outside a neighbours house, 6 crossways road that has been in the road for around 6-10 months. The skip is unlit and close to a bus stop. Parking is very limited and is taking up valuable space. Unable to park outside our own home because the neighbour has numerous cars/building work going on, we are on a busy road with traffic going past all day and night including buses. We have small children and I feel this is causing an unnecessary risk and is affecting our daily life.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Crossways Road, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated dog fouling and when approached the "gentleman" just walked on., 5th February
item.description:
Brown and white springer spaniel came from area of Croft Close and Grant Close maybe Boevey Path on a lead. I believe this dog owner is responsible for the mess in and around that area. When confronted and offered a bag he walked on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harold Avenue, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds & some fly tipping at bottom of alleyway near no.14 & 15., 5th February
item.description:
Weeds & some fly tipping right at the bottom of alleyway, near no.14 & 15 Nightingale Corner, St Mary Cray, BR5 3PS. Bottom half of this alleyway is owned by LBB. Please cut tge weeds & clear the fly tipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Wotton Green, St Mary Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cobblestones are loose, blister paving is damaged, paving slabs are severely cracked, 5th February
item.description:
All of these paving slabs and cobbles have been getting progressively worse for at least two years now. The cobblestones have loosened and are pronounced and are hazzardous to walkers. The blishter paving slabs are deteriorating and pieces are coming out. These are meant to be an aid for blind people. This damage was sustained (I believe) when heavy trucks were delivering items during construction works to buildings on Emerson Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Street, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds need cutting near 13 - 24 Nightingale Corner, 5th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Wotton Green, St Mary Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
